Musa.water: Water once per week, keep soil moist. Increase water during hot seasons but avoid waterlogging.
Musa.sunlight: Full sunlight, at least 6 hours of direct sunlight each day.
Musa.temperature: Prefer temperatures between 75°F and 95°F (24°C to 35°C). Avoid frost.
Musa.humidity: High humidity is preferred. Misting or using a humidifier is recommended.
Musa.soil: Well-draining, rich in organic matter. A peat-based mix is ideal.
Musa.fertilization: Fertilize monthly during the growing season with a balanced fertilizer.

Chlorophytum comosum.water: Water once a week, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings. In winter, water less frequently.
Chlorophytum comosum.sunlight: Bright, indirect light. Can tolerate lower light but will grow slower.
Chlorophytum comosum.temperature: Prefers temperatures between 60°F and 75°F (16°C to 24°C). Avoid temperatures below 50°F (10°C).
Chlorophytum comosum.humidity: Tolerant of average humidity but thrives in moderate humidity levels.
Chlorophytum comosum.soil: Well-draining potting mix, preferably one designed for houseplants.
Chlorophytum comosum.fertilization: Fertilize monthly during the growing season with a diluted liquid fertilizer.

Ficus elastica.water: Water when the top 1-2 inches of soil is dry. Avoid overwatering.
Ficus elastica.sunlight: Bright, indirect light. Can tolerate some direct sunlight.
Ficus elastica.temperature: Prefers temperatures between 60°F and 75°F (15°C to 24°C). Avoid drafts and temperature fluctuations.
Ficus elastica.humidity: Average to high humidity. If the air is dry, consider misting or using a humidity tray.
Ficus elastica.soil: Well-draining, light potting soil with good organic content.
Ficus elastica.fertilization: Fertilize once a month during the growing season with a balanced liquid fertilizer.

Spathiphyllum.water: Water when the top of the soil feels dry. Keep the soil moist, but not soggy.
Spathiphyllum.sunlight: Low to medium indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight.
Spathiphyllum.temperature: Thrives in temperatures between 65°F and 80°F (18°C to 27°C).
Spathiphyllum.humidity: Prefers high humidity. Regular misting is recommended.
Spathiphyllum.fertilization: Fertilize with a balanced liquid fertilizer once a month during the growing season.

Aloe Vera.water: Water deeply but infrequently. Allow the soil to dry completely before watering again.
Aloe Vera.sunlight: Full sunlight. Needs at least 6 hours of direct sunlight daily.
Aloe Vera.temperature: Ideal temperatures between 59°F and 77°F (15°C to 25°C). Can tolerate slightly warmer temperatures but not frost.
Aloe Vera.humidity: Low humidity. Aloe Vera is a succulent that prefers dry conditions.
Aloe Vera.soil: Well-draining, sandy soil. A cactus mix or a similar mix with good drainage is ideal.
Aloe Vera.fertilization: Fertilize once a year with a low-nitrogen fertilizer during the growing season.

Cactus.water: Water only when the soil is completely dry. Water deeply, but infrequently.
Cactus.sunlight: Full sunlight, at least 6 hours per day.
Cactus.temperature: Temperatures between 70°F and 100°F (21°C to 38°C) are ideal. Avoid cold temperatures below 50°F (10°C).
Cactus.humidity: Low humidity. Cacti prefer dry air.
Cactus.soil: Well-draining soil, such as a cactus or succulent mix.
Cactus.fertilization: Fertilize lightly once during the growing season (spring to early fall) with a low-nitrogen fertilizer.

Peace Lily (Spathiphyllum).water: Keep the soil moist, but allow the top layer to dry out between waterings.
Peace Lily (Spathiphyllum).sunlight: Low to medium indirect light. It can tolerate some shade.
Peace Lily (Spathiphyllum).temperature: Prefers temperatures between 65°F and 80°F (18°C to 27°C). Avoid sudden temperature drops.
Peace Lily (Spathiphyllum).humidity: Prefers high humidity. Mist regularly or place a humidity tray nearby.
Peace Lily (Spathiphyllum).soil: Rich, well-draining potting soil. A mix designed for tropical houseplants is ideal.
Peace Lily (Spathiphyllum).fertilization: Fertilize monthly during the growing season with a balanced fertilizer.

Monstera deliciosa.water: Water when the top 2 inches of soil feel dry. In winter, reduce watering.
Monstera deliciosa.sunlight: Bright, indirect light. Can tolerate some direct sunlight but avoid long exposure.
Monstera deliciosa.temperature: Prefers temperatures between 65°F and 85°F (18°C to 29°C). Avoid temperatures below 50°F (10°C).
Monstera deliciosa.humidity: High humidity is ideal. Regular misting helps.
Monstera deliciosa.soil: Well-draining, rich potting soil. A peat-based mix is preferred.
Monstera deliciosa.fertilization: Fertilize once a month during the growing season with a balanced liquid fertilizer.

Snake Plant (Sansevieria).water: Allow the soil to dry completely between waterings. Water less frequently in winter.
Snake Plant (Sansevieria).sunlight: Tolerates low light but prefers indirect light. Can survive in low light conditions.
Snake Plant (Sansevieria).temperature: Prefers temperatures between 60°F and 85°F (16°C to 29°C). Tolerant of a wide range of temperatures.
Snake Plant (Sansevieria).humidity: Low humidity. Tolerates dry air well.
Snake Plant (Sansevieria).soil: Well-draining potting mix, preferably cactus or succulent mix.
Snake Plant (Sansevieria).fertilization: Fertilize every 2-3 months during the growing season with a low-nitrogen fertilizer.

Succulents.water: Water deeply but infrequently. Allow soil to dry completely between waterings.
Succulents.sunlight: Full sunlight, 6 hours or more per day. Some can tolerate partial sunlight.
Succulents.temperature: Ideal temperatures between 60°F and 85°F (15°C to 29°C). Avoid temperatures below 50°F (10°C).
Succulents.humidity: Low humidity. They are adapted to dry climates.
Succulents.soil: Well-draining, sandy soil. A cactus or succulent mix is ideal.
Succulents.fertilization: Fertilize once during the growing season with a diluted, balanced fertilizer.

Iris sibirica.water: Requires regular watering, especially during the growing season. Keep soil moist but well-draining. It can tolerate wetter conditions compared to other irises, but avoid waterlogging.
Iris sibirica.sunlight: Full sunlight to partial shade. Iris sibirica prefers full sun but can tolerate light shade, especially in warmer climates.
Iris sibirica.temperature: Thrives in temperatures between 55°F and 75°F (13°C to 24°C). It can tolerate frost, making it suitable for cooler climates.
Iris sibirica.humidity: Moderate humidity is ideal. It tolerates slightly moist air but prefers good air circulation.
Iris sibirica.soil: Well-draining, moist, rich, and slightly acidic soil. It does well in soils with organic matter.
Iris sibirica.fertilization: Fertilize in early spring as new growth appears, using a balanced fertilizer. Avoid over-fertilizing, as this can lead to excessive foliage growth and fewer blooms.

Iris setosa.water: Requires consistently moist soil. Iris setosa can tolerate wetter soil than many other irises but should not be in standing water. Ensure the soil remains moist during the growing season.
Iris setosa.sunlight: Full sunlight to partial shade. It thrives in bright, sunny spots but can tolerate partial shade, particularly in hotter climates.
Iris setosa.temperature: Prefers cooler climates, with ideal temperatures between 50°F and 70°F (10°C to 21°C). Can tolerate frost and mild winters.
Iris setosa.humidity: Moderate to high humidity is beneficial. Iris setosa can tolerate moist air but requires good air circulation to avoid fungal diseases.
Iris setosa.soil: Moist, well-draining, and rich in organic material. Prefers slightly acidic to neutral pH levels.
Iris setosa.fertilization: Fertilize in early spring with a balanced fertilizer. Avoid high-nitrogen fertilizers to prevent too much leaf growth.

Iris versicolor.water: Prefers moist soil, particularly near water or in wetlands. Ensure soil is consistently moist but well-draining. It can tolerate wet feet, making it ideal for water gardens.
Iris versicolor.sunlight: Full sunlight to partial shade. Iris versicolor does best in full sun but can tolerate partial shade, especially in hotter climates.
Iris versicolor.temperature: Ideal temperatures between 60°F and 75°F (16°C to 24°C). Can tolerate frost but does best in moderate temperatures.
Iris versicolor.humidity: Moderate to high humidity. Prefers humid conditions and can thrive in moisture-rich environments like ponds or streams.
Iris versicolor.soil: Moist, well-draining, and rich in organic matter. Prefers slightly acidic to neutral soil with good drainage.
Iris versicolor.fertilization: Fertilize lightly with a balanced fertilizer in early spring as new growth emerges. Avoid over-fertilizing, as it may promote more foliage than flowers.
